physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white portrait photograph. It features a man, wearing a military uniform, standing poised and looking into the camera. He is dressed in long-sleeved collared top and long pants. His left hand is holding the middle of his belt, while his right hand is tucked into his pant pocket. He is standing on a grassy field, with one tree behind him. In the distant background, there are several tents set up on the field. The edges of the photograph are uneven.
sgcool_label_text: A variety of portraits of British soldiers that show them at leisure as well as two photographs of James Steele placing a wreath at a remembrance ceremony, this collection is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Group of 50 photographs of P.O.W James Steele and regiment when stationed in Malaysia in 1941 (and 2 later photographs of Steele placing a wreath at ceremony of remembrance)  Dr Lacey, Mersing 1941
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
